src.GameObjects

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.GameObjects.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Character, Item, Particle, Projectile, Tile

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    Any object that exists in the game world is an Entity

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(double x,
              double y,
              double size,
              java.util.ArrayList<org.newdawn.slick.Image> spriteList)
        Instantiate a new entity in the game world
        Parameters:
        x - The world x-coordinate of the entity
        y - The world y-coordinate of the entity
        size - The world size of the entity
        spriteList - The list of sprites to be used by the enemy for animation

    • Method Detail

      • nextSprite

        protected void nextSprite()
        Move the current sprite being displayed to the next sprite in the animation. If the animation cycle has completed, go back to the first sprite.

      • resetSprite

        protected void resetSprite()
        Reset the current sprite back to the default sprite

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        A method that all methods must have and implement themselves. This is the logic that affects the state of the entity in the world.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Get the x-coordinate of the entity in the world
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the entity

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Get the y-coordinate of the entity in the world
        Returns:
        The y-coordinate of the entity

      • getSize

        public double getSize()
        Get the size of the entity in the world
        Returns:
        The entity size

      • draw

        public void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                 Camera c)
        Draw the entity onto the screen
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw the entity onto
        c - The Camera object to determine the location of the entity on the screen

      • moveWorldX

        public void moveWorldX(double diff)
        Move the entity along the x-axis by a given distance
        Parameters:
        diff - The difference in position that the entity should move

      • moveWorldY

        public void moveWorldY(double diff)
        Move the entity along the y-axis by a given distance
        Parameters:
        diff - The difference in position that the entity should move

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Constants.DIRECTION d)
        Set the current direction that the entity is facing
        Parameters:
        d - The direction to face

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Entity e)
        Check if this entity collides with another, given, entity
        Parameters:
        e - The entity to check for collision
        Returns:
        Whether or not the entities collide
